Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty
travel.author: Albert Einstein

travel.quote: The farther I travel, the closer I am to myself
travel.author: Andrew McCarthy

travel.quote: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don’t be sorry
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: Getting lost is sometimes the best way to find yourself
travel.author: Maxime Lagacé

travel.quote: Not all those who wander are lost. J.R.R
travel.author: Tolkien

travel.quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us. J.R.R
travel.author: Tolkien

travel.quote: Collect moments. Not things
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: I haven’t been everywhere but it’s on my list
travel.author: Susan Sontag

travel.quote: I was surprised, as always, by how easy the act of leaving was, and how good it felt. The world was suddenly rich with possibility
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: Only those who risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go. T.S
travel.author: Eliot

travel.quote: We are travelers on a cosmic journey, stardust swirling and dancing in eddies and whirlpools in infinity. Life is eternal. We have stopped for a moment to encounter each other, to meet, to love, to share. This is a precious moment. It is a little parenthesis in eternity
travel.author: Paulo Coelho

travel.quote: Travel and change of place impart new vigor to the mind
travel.author: Seneca

travel.quote: He who does not travel does not know the value of men
travel.author: Moorish proverb

travel.quote: Who lives sees, but who travels sees more
travel.author: Ibn Battuta

travel.quote: The best dreams happen when you’re awake
travel.author: Cherie Gilderbloom

travel.quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent upon arriving
travel.author: Lao Tzu

travel.quote: I love to travel, but hate to arrive
travel.author: Albert Einstein

travel.quote: To awaken quite alone in a strange town is one of the pleasantest sensations in the world
travel.author: Freya Stark (Game of Thrones

travel.quote: Not I, nor anyone else can travel that road for you. You must travel it by yourself
travel.author: Walt Whitman

travel.quote: What is more melancholy and more profound than to see a thousand objects for the first and the last time? To travel is to be born and to die at every instant
travel.author: Victor Hugo

travel.quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts
travel.author: Mark Twain

travel.quote: Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: People say that what we are all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think this is what we’re really seeking. I think what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive
travel.author: Joseph Campbell

travel.quote: To travel is to take a journey into yourself
travel.author: Danny Kaye

travel.quote: A tourist sees what he came to see; a traveler sees what he sees
travel.author: Thibaut

travel.quote: I would rather own little and see the world, than own the world and see little of it
travel.author: Alexander Sattler

travel.quote: Vagabonding is about time – our only real commodity – and how we choose to use it
travel.author: Rolf Potts

travel.quote: The slow nuanced experience of a single country is always better than the hurried, superficial experience of forty countries
travel.author: Rolf Potts (Vagabonding: An Uncommon Guide to the Art of Long-Term World)

travel.quote: It is fatal to know too much at the outset: boredom comes as quickly to the traveler who knows his route as to the novelist who is overcertain of his plot
travel.author: Paul Theroux

travel.quote: Traveling hopefully into the unknown with a little information: dead reckoning is the way most people live their lives, and the phrase itself seems to sum up human existenec
travel.author: Paul Theroux

travel.quote: Wherever my travels may lead, paradise is where I am
travel.author: Voltaire

travel.quote: Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller
travel.author: Ibn Battuta

travel.quote: Traveler, there is no path, paths are made by walking
travel.author: Antonio Machado

travel.quote: If you really want to learn about a country, work there
travel.author: Charles Kuralt

travel.quote: Your true traveler finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty – his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure
travel.author: Aldous Huxley

travel.quote: Travel, which is like a greater and graver science, brings us back to ourselves
travel.author: Albert Camus

travel.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I – I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference
travel.author: Robert Frost

travel.quote: One the the great misfortunes of modern life is the want of any sudden surprise, and the absence of all adventures. Everything is so well arranged
travel.author: Theophile Gautier

travel.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore
travel.author: Andre Gide

travel.quote: The use of traveling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they really are
travel.author: Samuel Johnson

travel.quote: Often I feel I go to some distant region of the world to be reminded of who I really am…
travel.author: Michael Crichton

travel.quote: The whole object of travel is not to set foot on foreign land; it is at last to set foot on one’s own country as a foreign land. Gilbert K
travel.author: Chesterton

travel.quote: Traveling – it gives you home in thousand strange places, then leaves you a stranger in your own land
travel.author: Ibn Battuta

travel.quote: Travel… the best way to be lost and found at the same time
travel.author: Brenna Smith

travel.quote: Experience, travel – these are an education in themselves
travel.author: Euripides

travel.quote: Be brave, take risks. Nothing can substitute experience
travel.author: Paulo Coelho

travel.quote: Once a year go somewhere you have never been before
travel.author: Dalai Lama

travel.quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not
travel.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

travel.quote: Paris is always a good idea
travel.author: Audrey Hepburn

travel.quote: He who would travel happily must travel light
travel.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

travel.quote: Unexpected travel suggestions are dancing lessons from God
travel.author: Kurt Vonnegut

travel.quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive
travel.author: Buddha

travel.quote: A journey of a thousand miles starts with a single step
travel.author: Lao Tzu

travel.quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all
travel.author: Helen Keller

travel.quote: To travel is worth any cost or sacrifice
travel.author: Elizabeth Gilbert (Eat, Pray, Love)

travel.quote: If time travel is possible, where are the tourists from the future?
travel.author: Stephen Hawking

travel.quote: If you don’t know where you’re going, any road will take you there
travel.author: George Harrison (The Beatles, Any Road)

travel.quote: Yes, there are two paths you can go by, but in the long run, there’s still time to change the road you’re on
travel.author: Led Zeppelin (Stairway to Heaven)

travel.quote: There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars
travel.author: Jack Kerouac (On the Road)

travel.quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: The world is a book and he who don’t travel only read one page. St
travel.author: Augustine

travel.quote: I never knew of a morning in Africa, when I woke up and was not happy
travel.author: Ernest Hemingway

travel.quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover
travel.author: Mark Twain

travel.quote: I could have gone on flying through space forever
travel.author: Yuri Gagarin (First human to journey into outer space)

travel.quote: The sea will grant each man new hope, and sleep will bring dreams of home
travel.author: Christopher Columbus

travel.quote: I did not write half of what I saw, for I knew I would not be believed
travel.author: Marco Polo

travel.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes
travel.author: Marcel Proust

travel.quote: Better to see something once than to hear about it a thousand times
travel.author: Asian proverb

travel.quote: Don’t tell me how educated you are, tell me how much you traveled
travel.author: Mohammed

travel.quote: To travel is to live
travel.author: Hans Christian Andersen

travel.quote: All of life is a foreign country
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: Travel far enough, you meet yourself
travel.author: David Mitchell

travel.quote: We need the possibility of escape as surely as we need hope
travel.author: Rolf Potts

travel.quote: Travel teaches toleration
travel.author: Benjamin Disraeli

travel.quote: The journey is the destination
travel.author: Dan Eldon

travel.quote: Everywhere you travel to, be fully there
travel.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

travel.quote: Everybody has a unique path to travel
travel.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

travel.quote: The road never ends… only our vision does
travel.author: Amit Reddy

travel.quote: No matter where you go, there you are
travel.author: Buckaroo Banzi

travel.quote: What is life, without a little risk?
travel.author: Sirius Black (Harry Potter)

travel.quote: Risk is the salt and sugar of life
travel.author: Freya Stark

travel.quote: The greatest adventure is what lies ahead
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: It feels good to be lost in the right direction
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: If not now, when?
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Life is short and the world is wide
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Go, fly, roam, travel, voyage, explore, journey, discover, adventure
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Work, travel, save, repeat
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Just go. Go see all the beauty in the world
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Don’t listen to what they say, go see
travel.author: Chinese proverb

travel.quote: Adventure is worthwhile
travel.author: Aristotle

travel.quote: Oh, the places you’ll go. Dr
travel.author: Seuss

travel.quote: The journey is my home
travel.author: Muriel Rukeyser

travel.quote: Make voyages! Attempt them. There’s nothing else
travel.author: Tennessee Williams

travel.quote: The goal is to die with memories not dreams
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Wandering re-establishes the original harmony which once existed between man and the universe
travel.author: Anatole France

travel.quote: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it
travel.author: Paulo Coelho (The Alchemist)

travel.quote: I see my path, but I don’t know where it leads. Not knowing where I’m going is what inspires me to travel it
travel.author: Rosalia de Castro

travel.quote: Wanting to travel reflects a positive attitude. You want to see, to grow in experience, and presumably to become more whole as a human being
travel.author: Ed Buryn

travel.quote: Vagabonding is about using the prosperity and possibility of the information age to increase your personal options instead of your personal possessions
travel.author: Rolf Potts

travel.quote: Part 1. For my part, I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel’s sake. The great affair is to move
travel.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

travel.quote: Part 2. To feel the needs and hitches of our life more nearly; to come down off this feather-bed of civilization, and find the globe granite underfoot and strewn with cutting flints
travel.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

travel.quote: Do you really want to look back on your life and see how wonderful it could have been had you not been afraid to live it?
travel.author: Caroline Myss

travel.quote: Part 1. A lot of us first aspired to far-ranging travel and exotic adventure early in our teens; these ambitions are, in fact, adolescent in nature, which I find an inspiring idea
travel.author: Tim Cahill

travel.quote: Part 2. Thus, when we allow ourselves to imagine as we once did, we know, with a sudden jarring clarity, that if we don’t go right now, we’re never going to do it. And we’ll be haunted by our unrealized dreams and know that we have sinned against ourselves gravely
travel.author: Tim Cahill

travel.quote: What I find is that you can do almost anything or go almost anywhere, if you’re not in a hurry
travel.author: Paul Theroux

travel.quote: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float; to gain all while you give; to roam the roads of lands remote; to travel is to live
travel.author: Hans Christian Andersen

travel.quote: I saw that my life was a vast glowing empty page and I could do anything I wanted
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: Don’t die without embracing the daring adventure your life was meant to be
travel.author: Steve Pavlina

travel.quote: I travel around the world in a way that tries to open my mind and give me empathy and inspire me to come home and make this world a better place
travel.author: Rick Steves

travel.quote: And then there is the most dangerous risk of all – the risk of spending your life not doing what you want on the bet you can buy yourself the freedom to do it later
travel.author: Randy Komisar

travel.quote: Travel is a creative act – not simply loafing and inviting your soul, but feeding on the imagination, accounting for each fresh wonder, memorizing, and moving on… and the best landscapes, apparently dense or featureless, hold surprises if they are studied patiently, in the kind of discomfort one can savor afterward
travel.author: Paul Theroux

travel.quote: We travel initially, to lose ourselves; and we travel, next, to find ourselves. We travel to open our hearts and eyes and learn more about the world than our newspaper will accommodate
travel.author: Pico Iyer

travel.quote: Part 1. What gives value to travel is fear. It is the fact that, at a certain moment, when we are so far from our own country we are seized by a vague fear, and an instinctive desire to go back to the protection of old habits. This is the most obvious benefit of travel
travel.author: Albert Camus

travel.quote: Part 2. At that moment we are feverish but also porous, so that the slightest touch makes us quiver to the depths of our being
travel.author: Albert Camus

travel.quote: Leaving home is a kind of forgiveness, and when you get among strangers, you’re amazed at how decent they seem. Nobody smirks at you or gossips about you, nobody resents your successes or relishes your defeats. You get to start over, a sort of redemption
travel.author: Garrison Keilor

travel.quote: Part 1. Let’s not travel to tick things off lists, or collect half-hearted semi-treasures to be placed in dusty drawers in empty rooms
travel.author: Victoria Erickson

travel.quote: Part 2. Rather, we’ll travel to find grounds and rooftops and tiny hidden parks, where we’ll sit and dismiss the passing time, spun in the city’s web, ‘til we’ve surrendered, content to be spent and consumed
travel.author: Victoria Erickson

travel.quote: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone
travel.author: Neale Donald Walsch

travel.quote: By seeing how small the world is, I realize how capable I am. I can conquer anything. Anywhere. Anyone
travel.author: Tawny Lara

travel.quote: Many a trip continues long after movement in time and space have ceased
travel.author: John Steinbeck

travel.quote: Jobs fill your pockets, but adventures fill your soul
travel.author: Jaime Lyn

travel.quote: Walking is a virtue, tourism is a deadly sin
travel.author: Bruce Chatwin

travel.quote: Two great talkers will not travel far together
travel.author: Spanish proverb

travel.quote: Half the fun of the travel is the esthetic of lostness
travel.author: Ray Bradbury

travel.quote: I don’t know where I am going but I’m on my way
travel.author: Carl Sagan

travel.quote: To lose a passport was the least of one’s worries. To lose a notebook was a catastrophe
travel.author: Bruce Chatwin

travel.quote: When you see someone putting on his Big Boots, you can be pretty sure that an Adventure is about to happen
travel.author: Winnie The Pooh

travel.quote: Tourists don’t know where they’ve been, travelers don’t know where they’re going
travel.author: Paul Theroux

travel.quote: A tourist is a fellow who drives thousands of miles so he can be photographed standing in front of his car
travel.author: Emile Ganest

travel.quote: I dislike feeling at home when I am abroad
travel.author: George Bernard Shaw

travel.quote: Once the travel bug bites there is no known antidote, and I know that I shall be happily infected until the end of my life
travel.author: Michael Palin

travel.quote: If you reject the food, ignore the customs, fear the religion and avoid the people, you might better stay home
travel.author: James Michener

travel.quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read on the train
travel.author: Oscar Wilde

travel.quote: I travel a lot; I hate having my life disrupted my routine
travel.author: Caskie Stinnett

travel.quote: Jet lag is for amateurs
travel.author: Dick Clark

travel.quote: To lose a passport was the least of one’s worries. To lose a notebook was a catastrophe
travel.author: Bruce Chatwin

travel.quote: When preparing to travel, lay out all your clothes and all your money. Then take half the clothes and twice the money
travel.author: Susan Heller

travel.quote: Because in the end, you won’t remember the time you spent working in the office or mowing your lawn. Climb that goddamn mountain
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: If we were meant to stay in one place, we’d have roots instead of feet
travel.author: Rachel Wolchin

travel.quote: Better to sleep in an uncomfortable bed free, than sleep in a comfortable bed unfree
travel.author: Jack Kerouac

travel.quote: The best tourist is one without a camera
travel.author: Kamand Kojouri

travel.quote: Let your memory be your travel bag
travel.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

travel.quote: The traveler sees what he sees, the tourist sees what he has come to see. G.K
travel.author: Chesterton

travel.quote: There is no foreign land; it is the traveller only that is foreign
travel.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

travel.quote: Travel and tell no one, live a true love story and tell no one, live happily and tell no one, people ruin beautiful things
travel.author: Kahlil Gibran

travel.quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world
travel.author: Virginia Woolf

travel.quote: A child on a farm sees a plane fly overhead and dreams of a faraway place. A traveler on the plane sees the farmhouse…and thinks of home
travel.author: Carl Burns

travel.quote: People say you have to travel to see the world. Sometimes I think that if you just stay in one place and keep your eyes open, you’re going to see just about all that you can handle
travel.author: Paul Auster

travel.quote: This is the charm of a map. It represents the other side of the horizon where everything is possible
travel.author: Rosita Forbes

travel.quote: Travel is never a matter of money but of courage
travel.author: Paulo Coelho

travel.quote: Live your life by a compass, not a clock
travel.author: Stephen Covey

travel.quote: As you move through this life and this world you change things slightly, you leave marks behind, however small. And in return, life — and travel — leaves marks on you. Most of the time, those marks — on your body or on your heart — are beautiful. Often, though, they hurt
travel.author: Anthony Bourd

travel.quote: A man of ordinary talent will always be ordinary, whether he travels or not; but a man of superior talent will go to pieces if he remains forever in the same place
travel.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

travel.quote: We travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape us
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: Traveling allows you to become so many different versions of yourself
travel.author: Unknown

travel.quote: When will you begin that long journey into yourself?
travel.author: Rumi

travel.quote: Whenever I prepare for a journey I prepare as though for death. Should I never return, all is in order
travel.author: Katherine Mansfield

travel.quote: People travel to wonder at the height of the mountains, at the huge waves of the seas, at the long course of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motion of the stars, and yet they pass by themselves without wondering. St
travel.author: Augustine

travel.quote: The practice of soulful travel is to discover the overlapping point between history and everyday life; the way to find the essence of every place, every day: in the markets, small chapels, out-of-the-way parks, craft shops
travel.author: Phil Cousineau

travel.quote: My city and country, so far as I am Antoninus, is Rome; but so far as I am a man, it is the world
travel.author: Marcus Aurelius

travel.quote: Part 1. Those who visit foreign nations, but associate only with their own countrymen, change their climate, but not their customs
travel.author: Charles Caleb Colton

travel.quote: Part 2. They see new meridians, but the same men; and with heads as empty as their pockets, return home with traveled bodies, but untraveled minds
travel.author: Charles Caleb Colton

travel.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of majority, it’s time to pause and reflect
travel.author: Mark Twain

travel.quote: Remember at all times that while you are seeing the world, the world will see you
travel.author: Benjamin Rush

travel.quote: He who is outside his door has the hardest part of his journey behind him
travel.author: Dutch proverb

travel.quote: The questions is not what you look at, but what you see
travel.author: Henry David Thoreau

travel.quote: Travel doesn’t become adventure until you leave yourself behind
travel.author: Marty Rubin

travel.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive
travel.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

travel.quote: With age, comes wisdom. With travel, comes understanding
travel.author: Sandra Lake

travel.quote: Travelling is discovering. Discovering is learning. Learning is living
travel.author: Maxime Lagacé

travel.quote: It is not down in any map; true places never are
travel.author: Herman Melville

travel.quote: To the tourist, travel is a means to an end; to the traveler, it’s an end in itself
travel.author: Marty Rubin

travel.quote: No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow
travel.author: Lin Yutang

travel.quote: I always wonder why birds choose to stay in the same place when they can fly anywhere on earth, then I ask myself the same question
travel.author: Harun Yahya

travel.quote: He who has seen one cathedral ten times has seen something; he who has seen ten cathedrals once has seen but little; and he who has spent half an hour in each of a hundred cathedrals has seen nothing at all
travel.author: Sinclair Lewis

travel.quote: Travel’s greatest purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one
travel.author: William Hazlitt

travel.quote: The value of your travels does not hinge on how many stamps you have in your passport when you get home
travel.author: Rolf Potts

travel.quote: People travel to faraway places to watch, in fascination, the kind of people they ignore at home
travel.author: Rolf Potts

travel.quote: Travel can be a kind of monasticism on the move: on the road, we often live more simple, with no more possessions than we can carry, and surrendering ourselves to chance. This is what Camus meant he said that "what gives value to travel is fear" – disruption, in other words, (or emancipation) from circumstance, and all the habits behing which we hide
travel.author: Pico Iyer

travel.quote: Curiosity about the extraordinary in the ordinary moves the heart of the traveler intent on seeing behind the veil of tourism
travel.author: Phil Cousineau

travel.quote: Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends… The mind can never break off from the journey
travel.author: Pat Conroy

travel.quote: It’s not where you are today that counts. It’s where you are headed. Arthur F
travel.author: Lenehan

travel.quote: Ownership of most things is overrated. Ownership of worldly experience is not
travel.author: Dave Levant

travel.quote: A great way to learn about your country is to leave it
travel.author: Henry Rollins

travel.quote: All travel has its advantages. If the passenger visits better countries, he may learn to improve his own, and if fortune carries him to worse, he may learn to enjoy it
travel.author: Samuel Johnson

travel.quote: The true fruit of travel is perhaps the feeling of being nearly everywhere at home
travel.author: Freya Stark

travel.quote: I have found out that there ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them
travel.author: Mark Twain

travel.quote: To my mind, the greatest reward and luxury of travel is to be able to experience everyday things as if for the first time, to be in a position in which almost nothing is so familiar it is taken for granted
travel.author: Bill Bryson

travel.quote: Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen
travel.author: Benjamin Disraeli

travel.quote: One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things
travel.author: Henry Miller

travel.quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries
travel.author: Aldous Huxley

travel.quote: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse
travel.author: Thomas Fuller

travel.quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart!
travel.author: Confucius

travel.quote: It is good to collect things, but it is better to go on walks
travel.author: Anatole France

travel.quote: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for. John A
travel.author: Shedd
